Station Waiting Rooms Remain Open 24/7 Thru Sunday Afternoon, Feb. 22
LIRR station waiting rooms will remain open around-the-clock through Sunday afternoon, February 22, to accommodate customers waiting for trains during cold and inclement weather.

LIRR customers are advised to be cautious when on station staircases and platforms and when boarding and exiting trains. Please walk, don't run on platforms and stairs and allow for extra travel time. For the latest service updates please monitor www.mta.info, download the LIRR's TrainTime app, and follow us on Twitter and Facebook.

Charge It! Onboard Credit Card Payment Program Expanding to All Lines

Metro-North is expanding the use of its new Ticket Issuing Machines (TIMs) which enable customers to use credit cards to purchase tickets onboard your train to all lines. The majority of conductors will have the new devices by mid-April. Listen for train announcements or ask your conductor if the option to pay by credit card is available. See more details at http://bit.ly/1qJ7CDX

Babylon Elevator Removed from Service Today

Starting today, February 9, the elevator at Babylon Station will be taken out of service for repair. To access the platform, use the stairs or escalator. Those having difficulty with stairs may wish to consider temporarily commuting to and from the Wyandanch Station on the Ronkonkoma Branch, which is equipped with ramps The elevator repair is expected to be finished by Friday, February 13th. See http://bit.ly/1bgzE30 for current elevator/escalator status.

Limited Harlem Line Bus/Train Harlem Line Service for Wed., Feb. 4

Metro-North Harlem Line train service on Wednesday, February 4, will remain suspended between Pleasantville and North White Plains until further notice due to the train/car collision near Valhalla. There will be limited bus/train service for Upper Harlem Line customers beginning with morning rush hour service on Wednesday and until further notice. See full details and bus schedule at http://bit.ly/SeCMH3 Please Note: -Customers are strongly encouraged to work from home if possible or should seek alternate service -Harlem Line tickets will be cross honored on the Hudson and New Haven Lines -Free parking will be available at Cortlandt Station on the Hudson Line -Westchester County parking made available on a first-come, first-served basis: Up to 300 spaces at the County Center near White Plains Station Up to 50 spaces at the North White Plains Station -Customers should expect crowded conditions and delays -Listen for announcements at your station

Limited Harlem Line Bus/Train Harlem Line Service for Wed., Feb. 4

Metro-North Harlem Line train service on Wednesday, February 4, will remain suspended between Pleasantville and North White Plains until further notice due to the train/car collision near Valhalla. There will be limited bus/train service for Upper Harlem Line customers beginning with morning rush hour service on Wednesday and until further notice. See full details and bus schedule at http://bit.ly/SeCMH3 Please Note: -Customers are strongly encouraged to work from home if possible or should seek alternate service -Harlem Line tickets will be cross honored on the Hudson and New Haven Lines -Free parking will be available at Cortlandt Station on the Hudson Line -Westchester County parking made available on a first-come, first-served basis: Up to 300 spaces at the County Center near White Plains Station Up to 50 spaces at the North White Plains Station -Customers should expect crowded conditions and delays -Listen for announcements at your station

MARINE PARKWAY GIL HODGES MEMORIAL BRIDGE - BOTH DIRECTIONS

The Marine-Gil Hodges Memorial Bridge is now closed to all traffic until 4am Wednesday, February 4, 2015 for maintenance. Motorists who normally use the bridge during this time must use the Cross Bay Veterans Memorial Bridge instead.

Courtesy Ride for Monthly Tickets Extend to 10 AM Tuesday
For those customers that did not use their monthly ticket courtesy ride on Monday, February 2, the LIRR has extended the courtesy ride to 10 AM Tuesday, February 3, due to the winter storm.

LIRR to Operate on Regular Weekday Schedule This Morning

The LIRR will be operating on a regular weekday schedule this morning, Tuesday, February 3. However, in the wake of the winter storm and sub-freezing temperatures, customers should anticipate delays and some canceled trains in the morning rush hour.

LIRR customers are advised to be extremely careful when on station staircases and platforms and when boarding and exiting trains, due to possible slippery conditions. Please walk, don't run on platforms and stairs and allow for extra travel time. For the latest service updates please monitor www.mta.info, download the LIRR's TrainTime app, and follow us on Twitter and Facebook.

LIRR to Operate on Regular Weekday Schedule Tuesday, February 3; Expect Delays & Some Canceled Trai

The LIRR will be operating on a regular weekday schedule on Tuesday, February 3. However, in the wake of the winter storm and sub-freezing temperatures, customers should anticipate delays and some canceled trains in the morning rush hour. For the LIRR's latest service updates please monitor www.mta.info, download the LIRR's TrainTime app, and follow us on Twitter & Facebook.
